variable.variable_name: Expanded Census 2010 Final Calibrated Trimmed Nonresponse Adjusted Final Weights - Year 1-3 (frozen as of 10/27/2011)
variable.variable_description: The calibrated sample weight is the calibrated, trimmed, non-response adjusted reciprocal of a participant's probability of selection into the HCHS/SOL study. The trimmed, nonresponse adjusted sample weights were calibrated using first the 7-category Hispanic Background distribution and then the 12-category age group/gender distribution using the 2010 Decennial Census. This variable is used for analyses purposes only.
variable.data_hierarchy: NSSR_HCHS/Administrative-Study Design/Expanded Census 2010 Final Calibrated Trimmed Nonresponse Adjusted Final Weights - Year 1-3 (frozen as of 10-27-2011)

variable.variable_name: FC-specific Normalized Census 2010 Calibrated Trimmed NonResponse Adjusted Final Weights - Year 1-3 (frozen as of 10/27/2011)
variable.variable_description: The FC-specific normalized sample weight is the field center specific normalized, calibrated, trimmed, non-response adjusted (household and person-level) reciprocal of a participant's probability of selection into the HCHS/SOL study. The calibrated, trimmed, non-response adjusted sample weights were normalized using the weighted mean divided by weighted standard deviation calculated for each field center separately and used to normalize the expanded calibrated sample weights (WEIGHT_Final_Norm_Center). This final sample weight variable is used for analyses purposes only when the subpopulation is restricted to within a single site.
variable.data_hierarchy: NSSR_HCHS/Administrative-Study Design/FC-specific Normalized Census 2010 Calibrated Trimmed NonResponse Adjusted Final Weights - Year 1-3 (frozen as of 10-27-2011)

variable.variable_name: Overall Sample Normalized Census 2010 Calibrated Trimmed NonResponse Adjusted Final Weights - Year 1-3 (frozen as of 10/27/2011)
variable.variable_description: The normalized sample weight is the overall normalized, calibrated, trimmed, nonresponse adjusted (household and person-level) reciprocal of a participant's probability of selection into the HCHS/SOL study. The base sample weights, i.e. the reciprocal of a participant's probability of selection into the HCHS/SOL study, were first adjusted by household-level and person-level non-response. The non-response adjusted sample weights were then trimmed using the selected average percentile that minimizes model MSE within each field center. All sample weights that fell above the selected percentile were trimmed to the selected percentile and the trimmed difference was evenly distributed among all of the non-trimmed sample weights. The trimmed, non-response adjusted sample weights were then calibrated using first the 7-category Hispanic Background distribution and then the 12-category age group/gender distribution using the 2010 Decennial Census. Finally, these calibrated, trimmed, non-response adjusted sample weights were normalized using the weighted mean divided by weighted standard deviation of the entire HCHS/SOL sample to normalize the expanded calibrated sample weights (WEIGHT_Final_Norm_Overall). This final sample weight variable is used for analyses purposes only.
variable.data_hierarchy: NSSR_HCHS/Administrative-Study Design/Overall Sample Normalized Census 2010 Calibrated Trimmed NonResponse Adjusted Final Weights - Year 1-3 (frozen as of 10-27-2011)

variable.variable_name: Overall Ankle Branchial Index (occlusion failure included)
variable.variable_description: Ankle Brachial Index (ABI) is the average ankle to arm systolic pressures as measured from the left and right sides. The higher of the two ankle measures on the same side is divided by the higher of the two systolic arm pressures to derive the right and left side ABI values. The overall ABI is the mean of those two measurements.
variable.data_hierarchy: NSSR_HCHS/Clinical Data-Vital Signs-Seated Blood Pressure/Overall Ankle Branchial Index (occlusion failure included)

variable.variable_name: Left 4-level grouped Ankle Brachial Index (occ. failure incl.)
variable.variable_description: This variable groups left and right ABI into 4 categories.
variable.data_hierarchy: NSSR_HCHS/Clinical Data-Vital Signs-Seated Blood Pressure/Left 4-level grouped Ankle Brachial Index (occ. failure incl.)

variable.variable_name: Right Ankle Branchial Index (occ. failure incl.)
variable.variable_description: Ankle Brachial Index (ABI) is the average ankle to arm systolic pressures as measured from the left and right sides. The higher of the two ankle measures on the same side is divided by the higher of the two systolic arm pressures to derive the right and left side ABI values.
variable.data_hierarchy: NSSR_HCHS/Clinical Data-Vital Signs-Seated Blood Pressure/Right Ankle Branchial Index (occ. failure incl.)

variable.variable_name: Right 4-level grouped Ankle Brachial Index (occ. failure incl.)

variable.data_hierarchy: NSSR_HCHS/Clinical Data-Vital Signs-Seated Blood Pressure/Right 4-level grouped Ankle Brachial Index (occ. failure incl.)

variable.variable_name: Average seated systolic blood pressure based on three measurements at a single clinic visit, with an interval of 30 seconds between each measurement
variable.data_hierarchy: NSSR_HCHS/Clinical Data-Vital Signs-Seated Blood Pressure/Average seated systolic blood pressure based on three measurements at a single clinic visit, with an interval of 30 seconds between each measurement

variable.variable_name: Average seated diastolic blood pressure based on three measurements, with an interval of 30 seconds between each measurement
variable.data_hierarchy: NSSR_HCHS/Clinical Data-Vital Signs-Seated Blood Pressure/Average seated diastolic blood pressure based on three measurements, with an interval of 30 seconds between each measurement

variable.variable_name: Acculturation Score - MESA
variable.variable_description: This is a summary acculturation score based on nativity, language spoken at home, and years of residence in the U.S. It is defined as the sum of nativity subscore and language subscore.
variable.data_hierarchy: NSSR_HCHS/Demographics-Acculturation/Acculturation Score - MESA

variable.variable_name: Age of immigration among participants who were not born in US mainland (50 US States + DC)
variable.variable_description: The age of immigration is defined as if participant was not born in the US 50 states, then the age of immigration is equal to the participant's age minus years lived in the US or if participant was born in the US 50 states, then the age of immigration is equal to missing.
variable.data_hierarchy: NSSR_HCHS/Demographics-Acculturation/Age of immigration among participants who were not born in US mainland (50 US States + DC)

variable.variable_name: Background with Other reclassified
variable.variable_description: The self-identification with a Hispanic/Latino cultural group allowed for selection of an 'other' designation. This variable groups the test responses of 'other' for variations of 'Dominican' so that undercounts do not occur for that group.
variable.data_hierarchy: NSSR_HCHS/Demographics-Acculturation/Background with Other reclassified

variable.variable_name: Background with Other reclassified (collapsed categories)
variable.variable_description: Variable collapses 'Central' and 'South American' categories into one group and the 'Other' and 'More than one heritage' categories into one group.
variable.data_hierarchy: NSSR_HCHS/Demographics-Acculturation/Background with Other reclassified (collapsed categories)

variable.variable_name: 7-level re-classification of Hispanic/Latino Background
variable.variable_description: Variable combined 'Other' and 'More than one heritage' categories into one group.
variable.data_hierarchy: NSSR_HCHS/Demographics-Acculturation/7-level re-classification of Hispanic-Latino Background

variable.variable_name: Ethnic identity score

variable.variable_description: This variable determines the participants immigrant generation status based on a combination of the country of origin of the participant, maternal and paternal parents, and/or the maternal and paternal grandparents.

variable.variable_name: Immigrant generation (4 categories)

variable.variable_name: Medical Outcomes Study 12-Item Short Form Survey SF-12: Mental component summary score (norm-based transformed)
variable.variable_description:
Summary component score of mental health. [Rand Health Care. 12-Item Short Form Survey (SF-12)](https://www.rand.org/health-care/surveys_tools/mos/12-item-short-form.html)

This sub-scale score is a norm-based transformation of standardized Z scores of the constituent items for the established domains which is scaled to a mean of 50 and standard deviation of 10.

[Search for all SF-12 variables within this dataset](https://sleepdata.org/datasets/hchs/variables?search=mossf12)

variable.variable_name: CESD 10-item total summary score
variable.variable_description: This variable is the sum of (WBEA1-WBEA10), where positively worded items (WBEA5, WBEA8) are reverse coded.  For participants with 1 or 2 missing items, CESD10 is equal to the weighted average of the nonmissing items*10.
variable.data_hierarchy: NSSR_HCHS/General Health-Quality of Life/CESD 10-item total summary score

variable.variable_name: CESD 10-item total summary score
variable.variable_description: This variable is the sum of (WBEA1-WBEA10), administered at the Sueno visit, where positively worded items (WBEA5, WBEA8) are reverse coded.  For participants with 1 or 2 missing items, CESD10 is equal to the weighted average of the nonmissing items*10.
variable.data_hierarchy: NSSR_HCHS/General Health-Quality of Life/CESD 10-item total summary score

variable.variable_name: 10-Item State-Trait Anxiety Inventory (State Anxiety Subscale) Score
variable.variable_description:
Summary score of the State-Trait Anxiety Iventory State Anxiety Subscale (10 items). [Spielberger CD et al., 1983. Manual for the State-Trait Anxiety Inventory. Palo Alto, CA: Consulting Psychologists Press.](https://doi.org/10.1037/t06496-000) The summary score has a range of 10 to 40. Higher scores indicate more severe anxiety.

This variable is the sum of (WBEA11-WBEA20), where positively worded items (WBEA12, WBEA17, WBEA19) are reverse coded, and 1 is added to all responses (converting from 0-3 to 1-4 scale to match the standardized instrument scoring). For participants with 1 or 2 missing items, STAI10 is equal to the weighted average of the nonmissing items*10.

[Search for all S-Anxiety variables within this dataset](https://sleepdata.org/datasets/hchs/variables?search=stais)
variable.data_hierarchy: NSSR_HCHS/General Health-Quality of Life/10-Item State-Trait Anxiety Inventory (State Anxiety Subscale) Score

variable.variable_name: 10-Item State-Trait Anxiety Inventory (State Anxiety Subscale) Score
variable.variable_description:
Summary score of the State-Trait Anxiety Iventory State Anxiety Subscale (10 items). [Spielberger CD et al., 1983. Manual for the State-Trait Anxiety Inventory. Palo Alto, CA: Consulting Psychologists Press.](https://doi.org/10.1037/t06496-000) The summary score has a range of 10 to 40. Higher scores indicate more severe anxiety.

This variable is the sum of (WBEA11-WBEA20), where positively worded items (WBEA12, WBEA17, WBEA19) are reverse coded, and 1 is added to all responses (converting from 0-3 to 1-4 scale to match the standardized instrument scoring). For participants with 1 or 2 missing items, STAI10 is equal to the weighted average of the nonmissing items*10.

[Search for all S-Anxiety variables within this dataset](https://sleepdata.org/datasets/hchs/variables?search=stais)
variable.data_hierarchy: NSSR_HCHS/General Health-Quality of Life/10-Item State-Trait Anxiety Inventory (State Anxiety Subscale) Score

variable.variable_name: Cerebrovascular Disease and Carotid Revascularization, self-report
variable.variable_description: This variable checks for medical history of stroke, mini-stroke or TIA, or balloon angioplasty or surgery to the arteries in the neck.
variable.data_hierarchy: NSSR_HCHS/Medical History/Cerebrovascular Disease and Carotid Revascularization, self-report

variable.variable_name: Self-reported CHD
variable.variable_description: This variable combines the self-reports of coronary revascularization or heart attack.
variable.data_hierarchy: NSSR_HCHS/Medical History/Self-reported CHD

variable.variable_name: Self-reported CHD at the Sueno visit
variable.variable_description: This variable combines the self-reports of coronary revascularization or heart attack.
variable.data_hierarchy: NSSR_HCHS/Medical History/Self-reported CHD at the Sueno visit

variable.variable_name: Diabetes Diagnosis
variable.variable_description: This variable describes the diagnoses of diabetes and whether it was diagnosed before baseline, not diagnosed before baseline but possibly detected from lab data, or as non-diabetic.
variable.data_hierarchy: NSSR_HCHS/Medical History/Diabetes Diagnosis

variable.variable_name: 3-level grouped Diabetes ver.1
variable.variable_description: This variable describes the stages of diabetes.
variable.data_hierarchy: NSSR_HCHS/Medical History/3-level grouped Diabetes ver.1

variable.variable_name: 3-level grouped Diabetes - ADA
variable.variable_description: This variable describes the stages of diabetes based on American Diabetes Association definition.
variable.data_hierarchy: NSSR_HCHS/Medical History/3-level grouped Diabetes - ADA

variable.variable_name: Diabetes Indicator - ADA
variable.variable_description: This variable is based on the Diabetes variable (version 2) stages of diabetes based on American Diabetes Association definition.
variable.data_hierarchy: NSSR_HCHS/Medical History/Diabetes Indicator - ADA

variable.variable_name: 3-level grouped Diabetes - includes self-report
variable.variable_description: This variable describes the stages of diabetes based on American Diabetes Association definition with an additional self-report criterion.
variable.data_hierarchy: NSSR_HCHS/Medical History/3-level grouped Diabetes - includes self-report

variable.variable_name: 4-level grouped diabetes (none/pre/treated/untreated)
variable.variable_description: This variable assesses diabetes using variable diabetes3 and medication use based on variables muea33c and med_antidaib.
variable.data_hierarchy: NSSR_HCHS/Medical History/4-level grouped diabetes (none-pre-treated-untreated)

variable.variable_name: 3-level grouped Diabetes - Lab
variable.variable_description: This variable describes the stages of diabetes.
variable.data_hierarchy: NSSR_HCHS/Medical History/3-level grouped Diabetes - Lab

variable.variable_name: Diabetes - self report only
variable.variable_description: This variable indicates a self-report of diabetes.
variable.data_hierarchy: NSSR_HCHS/Medical History/Diabetes - self report only

variable.variable_name: Diabetes controlled: DM Classified at Baseline and A1C < 7%
variable.variable_description: This variable indicates controlled diabetes. Defined only for diabetics.
variable.data_hierarchy: NSSR_HCHS/Medical History/Diabetes controlled: DM Classified at Baseline and A1C < 7%

variable.variable_name: Doctor/HCP number of visits in past 12 months
variable.variable_description: This variable defines grouped categories for the number of times a participant has visited the doctor in the last 12 months.
variable.data_hierarchy: NSSR_HCHS/Medical History/Doctor-HCP number of visits in past 12 months

variable.variable_name: Control of Hypertension - NHANES
variable.variable_description: This variable is defined for participants whose blood pressure are below the cutoff of 140/90 (both systolic and diastolic must be less than the cutoff values) for those who were defined as having hypertension using the NHANES definition only and also indicated whether or not they were receiving treatment for hypertension.
variable.data_hierarchy: NSSR_HCHS/Medical History/Control of Hypertension - NHANES

variable.variable_name: Treatment of Hypertension - NHANES
variable.variable_description: This variable is defined by the participant's self-report awareness of hypertension and self-report use of antihypertensive medications for those who were defined as having hypertension using the NHANES definition only.
variable.data_hierarchy: NSSR_HCHS/Medical History/Treatment of Hypertension - NHANES

variable.variable_name: Hypertension (BP>=140/90 and Med Use)
variable.variable_description: Hypertension is defined here if the systolic or diastolic blood pressure is greater than or equal to 140/90 or if the participant is currently taking antihypertensive medications.
variable.data_hierarchy: NSSR_HCHS/Medical History/Hypertension (BP>=140-90 and Med Use)

variable.variable_name: Hypertension using NHANES definition
variable.variable_description: Hypertension is defined here using the following NHANES definition: if the systolic or diastolic blood pressure is greater than or equal to 140/90 or if the participant self-reported as currently taking antihypertensive medications.
variable.data_hierarchy: NSSR_HCHS/Medical History/Hypertension using NHANES definition

variable.variable_name: 4-level grouped hypertension (none/pre/treated/untreated)
variable.variable_description: This variable classifies participants into 4 categories based on hypertension and hypertensive.
variable.data_hierarchy: NSSR_HCHS/Medical History/4-level grouped hypertension (none-pre-treated-untreated)

variable.variable_name: Metabolic Syndrome - IDF definition
variable.variable_description: The International Diabetes Federation (IDF) definition emphasizes central obesity because it is 'independently' associated with each of the other metabolic syndrome components, as well as insulin resistance.
variable.data_hierarchy: NSSR_HCHS/Medical History/Metabolic Syndrome - IDF definition

variable.variable_name: Metabolic Syndrome - NCEP ATP III
variable.variable_description: The following definition of metabolic syndrome is based on the updated Adult Treat Panel III (ATP III) of the National Cholesterol Education Program (NCEP) guidelines.
variable.data_hierarchy: NSSR_HCHS/Medical History/Metabolic Syndrome - NCEP ATP III

variable.variable_name: Metabolic Syndrome w/Self-Reported Meds - NCEP ATP III
variable.variable_description: This variable incorporates the original variable mets_ncep definition with changes to include self-reported medication use instead of scanned/transcribed medication use.
variable.data_hierarchy: NSSR_HCHS/Medical History/Metabolic Syndrome w-Self-Reported Meds - NCEP ATP III

variable.variable_name: Periodontitis Severity using CDC/AAP Grades
variable.variable_description: The HCHS/SOL used a comprehensive full mouth examination protocol examining six sites per tooth in up to 28 teeth yielding up to 168 sites per person. For the purpose of this study, four outcome measures were reported based on the Centers for Disease Control and Prevention and the American Academy of Periodontology (CDC/AAP) case definition of periodontitis at four severity thresholds. These classifications are designed for population-based surveillance of periodontal disease and are based on measures of clinical periodontal clinical attachment level (CAL) and probing pocket depth (PD).
variable.data_hierarchy: NSSR_HCHS/Medical History/Periodontitis Severity using CDC-AAP Grades

variable.variable_name: Standard deviation of the daily sleep efficiency on weekdays from actigraphy
variable.variable_description: Sleep efficiency is the proportion of sleep duration (i.e. total sleep time, tst) in total rest period (i.e. rest interval) in main sleep. Sleep duration is the interval between sleep onset time and sleep offset time while asleep. In this study, rest interval is the same as in-bed period.

variable.variable_name: Average sleep maintenance efficiency sleep in main sleep on weekdays from actigraphy
variable.variable_description:
Sleep maintenance efficiency is the ratio between sleep duration (i.e. total sleep time, tst) and sleep period in main sleep. Sleep duration is the interval between sleep onset time and sleep offset time while asleep, while sleep period is the interval between sleep onset time and sleep offset time.

This variable is similar to variable sawa34; however, sawa34 is derived from Actiware variable sawa24 before data optimization.

Sleep maintenance efficiency is the ratio between sleep duration (i.e. total sleep time, tst) and sleep period in main sleep. Sleep duration is the interval between sleep onset time and sleep offset time while asleep, while sleep period is the interval between sleep onset time and sleep offset time.

variable.variable_name: Average daily total sleep fragmentation index in main sleep on weekdays from actigraphy
variable.variable_description:
Sleep Fragmentation is an index of restlessness during the sleep period expressed as a percentage. [Kristen L et al. 2011 (PubMed ID:21411507)](https://www.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/pmc/articles/PMC3114508/)

There are three type of measures for sleep fragmentation: movement Index (MI), fragmentation index (FI), and total sleep fragmentation Index. The fragmentation index refers to the percentage of 60s periods of sleep out of the total number of periods of immobility. The movement index refers to the total of scored awake minutes divided by sleep period (i.e. total time in bed). The total sleep fragmentation index is the sum of FI and MI. (ActiGraph validation reference)[https://actigraphcorp.force.com/support/s/article/Sleep-Fragmentation-Index-Validation-Reference]
variable.data_hierarchy: NSSR_HCHS/Sleep Monitoring-Actigraphy/Average daily total sleep fragmentation index in main sleep on weekdays from actigraphy

variable.variable_name: Average daily total sleep fragmentation index in main sleep on workdays from actigraphy
variable.variable_description:
Sleep Fragmentation is an index of restlessness during the sleep period expressed as a percentage. [Kristen L et al. 2011 (PubMed ID:21411507)](https://www.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/pmc/articles/PMC3114508/)

There are three type of measures for sleep fragmentation: movement Index (MI), fragmentation index (FI), and total sleep fragmentation Index. The fragmentation index refers to the percentage of 60s periods of sleep out of the total number of periods of immobility. The movement index refers to the total of scored awake minutes divided by sleep period (i.e. total time in bed). The total sleep fragmentation index is the sum of FI and MI. (ActiGraph validation reference)[https://actigraphcorp.force.com/support/s/article/Sleep-Fragmentation-Index-Validation-Reference]
variable.data_hierarchy: NSSR_HCHS/Sleep Monitoring-Actigraphy/Average daily total sleep fragmentation index in main sleep on workdays from actigraphy

variable.variable_name: Average daily total sleep fragmentation index in main sleep across all days from actigraphy
variable.variable_description:
Sleep Fragmentation is an index of restlessness during the sleep period expressed as a percentage. [Kristen L et al. 2011 (PubMed ID:21411507)](https://www.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/pmc/articles/PMC3114508/)

There are three type of measures for sleep fragmentation: movement Index (MI), fragmentation index (FI), and total sleep fragmentation Index. The fragmentation index refers to the percentage of 60s periods of sleep out of the total number of periods of immobility. The movement index refers to the total of scored awake minutes divided by sleep period (i.e. total time in bed). The total sleep fragmentation index is the sum of FI and MI. (ActiGraph validation reference)[https://actigraphcorp.force.com/support/s/article/Sleep-Fragmentation-Index-Validation-Reference]

This variable is similar to variable sawa64; however, sawa26 is generated by Actiware software before data optimization.
variable.data_hierarchy: NSSR_HCHS/Sleep Monitoring-Actigraphy/Average daily total sleep fragmentation index in main sleep across all days from actigraphy

variable.variable_name: Average daily total sleep fragmentation index in main sleep across all days from actigraphy
variable.variable_description:
Sleep Fragmentation is an index of restlessness during the sleep period expressed as a percentage. [Kristen L et al. 2011 (PubMed ID:21411507)](https://www.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/pmc/articles/PMC3114508/)

There are three type of measures for sleep fragmentation: movement Index (MI), fragmentation index (FI), and total sleep fragmentation Index. The fragmentation index refers to the percentage of 60s periods of sleep out of the total number of periods of immobility. The movement index refers to the total of scored awake minutes divided by sleep period (i.e. total time in bed). The total sleep fragmentation index is the sum of FI and MI. (ActiGraph validation reference)[https://actigraphcorp.force.com/support/s/article/Sleep-Fragmentation-Index-Validation-Reference]

This variable is similar to variable sawa26; however, sawa26 is generated by Actiware software before data optimization.
variable.data_hierarchy: NSSR_HCHS/Sleep Monitoring-Actigraphy/Average daily total sleep fragmentation index in main sleep across all days from actigraphy

variable.variable_description:
sleep bouts are continuous blocks, one or more epochs in duration, with each epoch of each block scored as "sleep", between the start time and the end time of the given interval.

This variable is similar to variable sawa25; however, sawa25 is generated by Actiware software before data optimization.

variable.variable_name: Total Number of Apnea and Hypopnea: Apneas with no oxygen desaturation threshold used + hypopneas with > 50% flow reduction and no oxygen desaturation threshold used during artifact-free estimated sleep from type IV home sleep apnea test
variable.variable_description:
Apnea and hypopnea events were not distinguished as separate event types during scoring. Both were classified as a respiratory event that required a 50% reduction in Nasal Flow signal for at least 10 seconds.

Estimated sleep duration, providing an approximation of total sleep duration (i.e. total sleep time) inferred from analysis of non-EEG channels [Zhao et al., 2017 (PMID:27707441)]( https://www.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/pmc/articles/PMC5181603/) Any continuous periods of >=20 min with loss of respiratory channel was marked as wake and not included in the estimates.

variable.variable_name: Epworth Sleepiness Scale: Total score
variable.variable_description:
Calculated - Total score based on an 8-item questionnaires ranking likelihood of dozing off [Johns MW 1991 (PubMed ID: 1798888)](https://www.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/pubmed/1798888). Scale 0-3 for individual items; 0 to 24 for overall score.

Algorithm: The ESS is computed by adding ALL 8 ITEMS (SLEA12A TO SLEA12H). If any item is missing then ESS is missing. Warning: The levels of each item need to be recoded as follows: No chance (from 1 to 0), slight chance (from 2 to 1), moderate chance (from 3 to 2) and high chance (from 4 to 3).

[Search for all ESS variables within this dataset](https://sleepdata.org/datasets/hchs/variables?search=epworth)
variable.data_hierarchy: NSSR_HCHS/Sleep Questionnaires-Hypersomnia/Epworth Sleepiness Scale: Total score

variable.variable_name: Epworth Sleepiness Scale
variable.variable_description:
Calculated - Total score based on an 8-item questionnaires ranking likelihood of dozing off [Johns MW 1991 (PubMed ID: 1798888)](https://www.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/pubmed/1798888). Scale 0-3 for individual items; 0 to 24 for overall score.

Algorithm: The ESS_SUENO is computed by adding ALL 8 ITEMS (SPEA12A TO SPEA12H). If any item is missing then ESS_SUENO is missing. Warning: The levels of each item need to be recoded as follows: No chance (from 1 to 0), slight chance (from 2 to 1), moderate chance (from 3 to 2) and high chance (from 4 to 3).

[Search for all ESS variables within this dataset](https://sleepdata.org/datasets/hchs/variables?search=epworth)

variable.variable_name: Insomnia Severity Index: Total Score
variable.variable_description:
Summary score for the Insomnia Severity Index. [Morin CM, Insomnia, psychological assessment and management. Guilford Press, New York, 1993](https://pubmed.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/21532953/) Each item is scored from 0 to 4. Total score is the sum of all seven items (0 to 28), and catergorized as: absence of insomnia (0 to 7), sub-threshold insomnia (8 to 14), moderate insomnia (15 to 21), and severe insomnia (22 to 28).

This is a numeric variable with values ranging from 0-28 based on the Sleep Questionnaire II form. Missing if did not answer any of following: SQEA6, SQEA7, SQEA8, SQEA9. If SQEA10 answered 'Yes 1', but any of following missing: SQEA11, SQEA12, SQEA13, then missing. Missing if did not answer SQEA10 and SQEA11-SQEA13.

[Search for all ISI variables within this dataset](https://sleepdata.org/datasets/hchs/variables?search=isi)
variable.data_hierarchy: NSSR_HCHS/Sleep Questionnaires-Sleep Disturbance/Insomnia Severity Index: Total Score

variable.variable_name: Women's Health Initiative Insomnia Rating Scale: Total score
variable.variable_description:
Calculated - The Women's Health Initiative Insomnia Rating Scale (WHIIRS) has 5 items. Each item is scored on a 5 point scale (from 0-4). The total score is the sum of all five items ranging from 0 to 20. Higher score indicates more severe insomnia. A score of 9 or higher is considered clinically significant insomnia. [Levine et al.(2003)](https://psycnet.apa.org/record/2003-06188-004)

The score is calculated from non-missing values for any of the following five items: SLEA4, SLEA5, SLEA6, SLEA7 and SLEA11. The original items range from 0 to 4 and the total score from 0 to 20. In HCHS/SOL, SLEA form the scoring for questions 4 to 7 each ranged from 1 to 5 so 1 should be subtracted from each of these items to obtain the score for use in calculating WHIIRS.

[Search for all WHIIRS variables within this dataset](https://sleepdata.org/datasets/hchs/variables?search=whiirs)
